comments:
I thought we had this pretty well gaurded ... but, maybe some of these were at "source parser" level, instead of Tokenizer? We should learn to hard all our contentType describers so they would never get disabled due to a parser error. 
I do not know much about input ... would have likely been an ant file ... maybe have been coming/going to linux, so perhaps EOL got messed up?

Niitn, just adding you because I know you love these things :) 
I'll still take a look at better gauding against anything.

Well, on a positive note, it's at least the same symptom as bug 103852.  Could they both be this JFlex 1.4.0 bug which was corrected in 1.4.1?
 http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1060699&group_id=14929&atid=114929

Thanks Nitin. Yes, reading that bug, and its predecessor, 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=887821&group_id=14929&atid=114929
its pretty clear that's the root cause. 

I'll still look to see if we can gaurd against buggy code generators :) 
but looks like you've saved me a lot of head banging against brick wall. 
Thanks.
